text: Hey! Sorry for the late reply here - didn't get a notification pop up.

I'm a big believer in self initiated projects. Getting into the industry is so hard and as you say there's a lot of background experience required even for entry level roles. What got me going was doing small projects that I had good control over. Showreel filming for actors, one minute short films, competitions and the like. There's a great YouTube channel called Film Riot that's full of advice. I'm on there every week. Cinematography is so hot right now too that if you're good at it and can show that then you'll find yourself in demand.
As for the marketing side of my job... it was an accident :slightly_smiling_face:
